intro: Acetosella corniculata, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its rosette of small, spoon-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Acetosella corniculata is often found in temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America.
